definition: to take funds (esp. illegally or corruptly obtained)
to carry/to take along/to bring along/to hold (hands)/also pr. [xi1]
section/paragraph/funds/CL:筆|笔[bi3],個|个[ge4]/classifier for versions or models (of a product)

sentences.english: The company treasurer absconded with the funds.
After casting a stone at the police, they absconded with the money. (Ibid)
sentences.chinese: 他們向警察投擲石塊，後攜款潛逃。

sentences.english: After taking the cash, the thief iced him and ran away.
sentences.chinese: 拿了錢之後，那賊殺了他然後攜款潛逃了。

sentences.english: Scam it away, the right to name two suspects fled with money to Indonesia.
sentences.chinese: 騙局穿幫後，兩名權姓嫌疑人攜款逃往印度尼西亞。

sentences.english: The cashier absconded with the money.
As soon as he receives the goods, the buyer sells the goods and absconds with the money.
sentences.chinese: 他一收到貨就立即將其倒賣，攜款潛逃。
